temperature_setpoint.description: The target temperature value to be maintained within the fermenter, expressed in degrees Celsius (ÂºC).

pH_setpoint.description: Target pH value to be maintened within the fermenter throught the process.

pH_control_base_solution.description: The alkaline (base) solution used to control and maintain the pH within the fermenter, when it reaches below the setpoint.

pH_control_acid_solution.description: The acidic solution used to control and maintain the pH within the fermenter, when it rises above the setpoint.

culture_type.description: Origin of the culture??? Pre, Pre-Optional, Pre-final, Main. What are the main differences?

seed.description: Starter culture or initial culture prepared from a stock culture and grown until a certain concentration.

induce.description: Substance that triggers or enhances the expression of a gene or the activity of a metabolic pathway.

volume_unit_induction.description: Quantity of the inducer added, in uL.

DO_control_setpoint_percentage.description: Target value for dissolved oxygen, in percentage.

DO_control_cascade_level1.description: First level of the cascade control system for dissolved oxygen. Level 1 involves adjusting the stirrer_speed parameter to ahcieve the desired DO level.

maximum_stirring_speed.description: The maximum complete revolutions the stirrer makes in one minute.

minimum_stirring_speed.description: The minimum complete revolutions that stirrer makes in one minute.

DO_control_cascade_level2.description: Second level of the cascade control system for dissolved oxygen. Level 2 involves adjusting the air_flow parameter to ahcieve the desired DO level.

aeration_gas_type.description: Type of gas used for aeration in the fermenter.

maximum_aeration_slpm.description: Maximum rate of at which gas can be supplied to the fermenter, measured in slpm (standard liters per minute).

minimum_aeration_slpm.description: Minimum rate at which air gas can be supplied to the fermenter, measured in slpm (standard liters per minute).

DO_control_cascade_level3.description: Third level of the cascade control system for dissolved oxygen. Level 3 involves adjusting the o2_flow parameter to ahcieve the desired DO level.

starting_od.description: The optical density (OD) of the seed culture at the start of the bioprocess run, measuring the cell density or biomass concentration for the initial inoculum level.

final_seed_od.description: The cell density of the seed culturre at the time it is inoculated to the main fermenter.

initial_culture_volume.description: The total volume of the culture at the beginning of the bioprocess, representing the sum of culture medium and inoculum, no units.

culture_volume_unit.description: The unit of measurement for the culture volume, in mL.

feed_profile.description: Feeding strategies. IFR(Intermittent Feeding Regime: feeding pump in les than a 24 h time period), CFR(Continuous/Cyclic Feeding Regime: administered over 20-60 min every 4-6 hours wiht or without feeding pump), Bolus Feeding Regime(syringe or gravity drip over a 4-10 min period)

do.description: Level of free, non-compound oxygen ions present in an aqueous solution.

ph.description: Bioreactor Potential of Hydrogen (pH) reading. Logarithmic scale used to specify the acidity or basicity of aqueous solutions.

temperature.description: Bioreactor temperature reading. Pyhsical quantity that quantitatively expresses the attribute of hotness or coldness, reflecting the average kinetic energy of the vibrating and colliding atoms making up a substance.

liquid_volume.description: Total volume of liquid in the fermenter, measured in L.

liquid_volume_without_corrected_samples.description: Total volume of liquid in the fermenter without subtracting the sample volume extracted, measured in L.

sample_mass.description: The mass of the sample taken from the bioprocess/run, measured in grams. Implemented for quantifying the amount of biomass, product, other compounds.

sample_volume.description: The volume of the sample taken from the bioprocess/run, measured in mL. Implemented for calculating concentrations, dilutions, etc.

accumulated_sample_volume.description: Total volume of all samples taken from the bioprocess/run up to a certain point in time, measured in mL.

acid_volume.description: Volume of the acidic solution pumped into the fermenter, measured  in L.

base_volume.description: Volume of the base solution pumped into the fermenter, measured  in L.

base_rate.description: The flow rate at which the base solution is pumped into the fermenter, measured in L/h.

feed_rate_gavimetric.description: Rate at which the feed (based on its mass) is added to the bioproces, measured in kg/h.

feed_amount.description: The quantity or total mass of feed added to the bioprocess, measured in kg.

feed_volume.description: The volume of the feed solution pumped to the bioprocess at a certain time point, measured in L.

feed_rate_volumetric.description: Rate at which the feed (based on its volume) is added to the bioprocess, measured in L/h.

stirrer_speed.description: Speed at which the impeller shaft rotates, measured in rpm (revolutions per minute).

air_flow.description: Rate at which air is supplied to the fermnter, measured in lpm (liters per minute)

o2_flow.description: Rate at which oxygen is supplied to the fermenter, measured in lpm (liters per minute).

o2_percentage_inflow.description: Percentaje of oxygen in the gas mixture that is being supplied into the fermenter.

co2_percentage_inflow.description: Percentaje of CO2 in the gas mixture that is being supplied into the fermenter.

residual_compound_amount.description: The remaining amount of 'compound' left in the medium, expressed in g.

OD.description: OD600. Optical density to measure biomass. Absorbance is the logarithm of the ratio of incident to transmitted radiant power through a sample (excluding the effects on cell walls)

OUR.description: Oxygen Uptake Rate: Online determination of the rate at which O2 is consumed by cells. Ambr records it as unnormalized in mmol/h, with factor 0.001

CER.description: Online determination of the rate at which CO2 is produced by cells. Ambr records it as unnormalized in mmol/h, with factor 0.001.

OTR.description: Oxygen Transfer Rate (mol/h): rate at which O2 is transferred from the gas phase or fermenter air into the liquid phase within a fermenter.

CTR.description: Carbon dioxide Transfer Rate (mol/h): rate at which CO2 is transferred out of the fermenter. Important as CO2 is considered a by-product in aerobic processes, and so is a parameter used for predicting biomass concentration, evaluating energetic efficiencies of growth, monitoring growth yields and controlling fed batch processes like airflow rates or stir speeds.

RQ.description: Respiratory Quotient: Ratio of CO2 produced to O2 consumed during cellular metabolism throught the bioprocess/run, dimensionless number. Used to assess the metabolic state of cells.

formed_co2.description: Amount of CO2 generated during the bioprocess. Ambr records it as unnormalized, integrated, in moles.

consumed_o2.description: Amount of O2 consumed during the bioprocess. Ambr records it as unnormalized, integrated, in moles.

offgas_co2.description: The percentage of CO2 present in the exhaust stream leaving the fermenter, indicating the amount of CO2 produced.

offgas_o2.description: The percentage of O2 present in the exhaust stream leaving of the fermenter, indicating how much oxygen has been consumed.

compound.description: Concentration of the compound(substrate (ingredient), product or by-product) in the bioprocess, measured in g/L. Gases such as O2 and CO2 are considered compounds but independently.

biomass_concentration.description: Concentration of the biomass, measured in g/L.

dilution_rate.description: The rate at which fresh medium is fed into a main culture relative to the culture volume, representing the rate at which the culture is diluted, measured in 1/h.

c_balance.description: Balance which compares the total amount of carbon entering the fermenter (through the substrate) to the total carbon leaving the fermenter (in products, biomass or by.products like CO2), expressed in percentage.

c_balance_c_mols.description: The carbon balance calculated using carbon moles (c-mols), providing more molecular level view of the carbon flow, no units.

c_balance_to_substrate.synonyms: Elemental C balance with reference to substrate
c_balance_to_substrate.description: The carbon balance specifically referenced to the substrate usedin the bioprocess, to asses substrate utilization efficiency. No units.

dor_balance.description: Degree of Reduction (DoR) balance, important for understanding the redox balance in the bioprocess. The balance ensures that the electrons entering the bioprocess are equal to the electrons leaving it. It is expressed in percentage.

dor_yields.description: The degree of reduction calculated based on the yields of different products. This helps understand how efficiently the system is converting substrate into desired products, taking into account the redox state of each component.  No units.

substrate_consumed.description: The total amount of substrate consumed by the cells during the bioprocess, expressed in g.

substrate_consumed_molar.description: The total amount of substrate consumed by the cells during the bioprocess, expressed in moles.

substrate_consumed_c-molar.description: The total amount of substrate consumed by the cells during the bioprocess, expressed in cmols.

substrate_lost_in_sample.description: The amount of substrate removed from the run durning sampling, expressed in g.

substrate_uptake_rate.description: Substrate uptake rate (qs). The rate at which substrate is consumed by the cells, expressed in g/h.

substrate_uptake_rate_molar.description: The rate at which substrate is consumed by the cells, expressed in mol/h.

substrate_specific_uptake_rate.description: The rate of substrate uptake per unit of biomass, expressed in grams of substrate per grams of dry biomass per hour, 'g/g(DW)*h'

substrate_specific_uptake_rate_molar.description: The rate of substrate uptake per unit of biomass,, expressed in 'mol/cmol(X)*h'

substrate_specific_uptake_rate_mean_in_f.synonyms: D-glucose specific uptake rate_mean in Feed
substrate_specific_uptake_rate_mean_in_f.description: The average specific uptake rate of substrate during the feeding phase, expressed in grams of substrate per gram of biomass per hour (g/g(DW)*h)

substrate_specific_uptake_rate_max_in_fe.synonyms: D-glucose specific uptake rate_max in Feed
substrate_specific_uptake_rate_max_in_fe.description: The maximum specific uptake rate of substrate during the feeding phase, expressed in grams of substrate per gram of biomass per hour (g/g(DW)*h)

substrate_specific_uptake_rate_min_in_fe.synonyms: D-glucose specific uptake rate_min in Feed
substrate_specific_uptake_rate_min_in_fe.description: The minimum specific uptake rate of substrate during the feeding phase, expressed in grams of substrateper gram of biomass per hour (g/g(DW)*h).

substrate_yield_x.description: The amount of biomass produced per gram of substrate consumed, expressed in grams of biomass per gramsg/g(DW)

substrate_yield_molar_x.description: The amount of biomass produced per gram of substrate consumed, expressed in mol/c-mol(X)

substrate_yield_c_molar_x.description: The amount of biomass produced per gram of substrate consumed,expressed in c-,mol/c-mol(X)

o2_decimal.description: The decimal fraction of O2 in a gas stream, representing the proportion of O2 in the exhaust gas relative to the total gas volume, no units.

o2_partial_integration.description: A time-based integration of O2 production, often calculated for specific time intervals??????, no units.

o2_accumulated.description: The total amount of O2 consumed and measured over the course of the bioprocess, tracked as an accumulated value, no units

o2_accumulated_downscaled.description: The total molar quantity of O2 generated, expressed in mol

o2_q.description: The volumetric rate of O2 consumed by the bioprocess over time, expressed in L/h.

o2_molar.description: The molar rate of O2 production, measuring the quantity of O2 generated by the bioprocess in terms of moles, expressed in mol/h.

o2_specific_uptake_rate.description: The specific rate at which O2 is produced per unit of biomass (X), expressed in moles of O2 per carbon mole of biomass per hour (mol/c-mol(X)*h). Reflecting how efficiently O2 is consumed in relation to biomass production.

o2_yield_s.description: The yield of O2 consumed per mole of substrate consumed (S), expressed in moles of O2 per mole of substrate (mol/mol(S)), quantifying how much O2 is consumed relative to the substrate used in the bioprocess.

o2_yield_c_molar_s.description: The yield of O2 consumed per carbon mole of substrate consumed (S), expressed in moles of O2 per carbon mole of substrate (mol/c-mol(S)). More detailed yield accounting for the carbon content of the substrate.

o2_yield_x.description: The yield of O2 consumed per carbon mole of biomass (X), expressed in moles of O2 per carbon mole of biomass (mol/c-mol(X)), describing how much O2 is consumed relative to the amount of biomass generated.

compound_formed.description: Total amount of compound produced in the bioprocess, representing the cumulative production of the compound over time, measured in g.

compound_formed_molar.description: Total amount of compound produced in the bioprocess, expressed in moles(mol), providing molecular level quantification.

compound_formed_c_molar.description: Total amount of compound produced in the bioprocess, expressed in cmol, which is related with the carbon content of the compound.

compound_lost_in_sample.description: The amount of compound lost or removed from the fermenter during sampling, expressed in g.

compound_formation_rate.description: Rate at which the compound is produced over time, indicating the speed of compound production, expressed in g/h.

compound_formation_rate_molar.description: Rate at which the compound is produced over time, expressed in mol/h.

compound_specific_formation_rate.description: The rate of compound production per unit of biomass (dry weight), providing the efficiency of compound production relative to biomass. It is expressed in grams per gram of dry weight per hour (g/g(DW)*h).

compound_specific_formation_rate_molar.description: The rate of acetic acid production per unit of biomass, expressed in moles per carbon mole of biomass per hour (mol/cmol(X)*h).

compound_yield_s.description: The yield of compound produced per gram of substrate consumed, quantifying how much compound id produced relative to substrate consumption, expressed in g/g.

compound_yield_molar_s.description: The yield of compound produced per mole of substrate consumed, expressed in mol/mol (S)

compound_yield_c_molar_S.description: The yield of compound produced per carbon mole of substrate consumed, taking into account the carbon content of both the substrate and the compound, expressed in c-mol/c-mol(S)

compound_yield_x.description: The yield of 'compound' produced per gram of biomass (dry weight), measuring how efficiently compound is produced relative to biomass generation, expressed in grams per gram of dry weight (g/g(DW)).

compound_molar_x.description: The yield of 'compound' produced per carbon mole of biomass, expressed in moles per carbon mole of biomass per hour (mol/cmol(X)*h).

compound_yield_c_molar.description: The yield of 'compound' produced per carbon mole of biomass, expressed in c-mol/c-mol(X).

co2_decimal.description: The decimal fraction of CO2 in a gas stream, representing the proportion of CO2 in the exhaust gas relative to the total gas volume, no units

co2_molar.description: The molar rate of CO2 production, measuring the quantity of CO2 generated by the bioprocess in terms of moles, expressed in mol/h.

co2_partial_integration.description: A time-based integration of CO2 production, often calculated for specific time intervals??????, no units.

co2_accumulated.description: The total amount of CO2 produced and measured over the course of the bioprocess, tracked as an accumulated value, no units.

co2_accumulated_downscaled.description: The total molar quantity of CO2 generated, expressed in mol.

co2_q.description: The volumetric rate of CO2 produced by the bioprocess over time, expressed in L/h.

co2_specific_evolution_rate.description: The specific rate at which CO2 is produced per unit of biomass (X), expressed in moles of CO2 per carbon mole of biomass per hour (mol/c-mol(X)*h). Reflecting how efficiently CO2 is released in relation to biomass production.

co2_yield_s.description: The yield of CO2 produced per mole of substrate consumed (S), expressed in moles of CO2 per mole of substrate (mol/mol(S)), quantifying how much CO2 is produced relative to the substrate used in the bioprocess.

co2_yield_c_molar_s.description: The yield of CO2 produced per carbon mole of substrate consumed (S), expressed in moles of CO2 per carbon mole of substrate (mol/c-mol(S)). More detailed yield accounting for the carbon content of the substrate.

co2_yield_x.description: The yield of CO2 produced per carbon mole of biomass (X), expressed in moles of CO2 per carbon mole of biomass (mol/c-mol(X)), describing how much CO2 is produced relative to the amount of biomass generated.

biomass_amount.description: Total mass of biomass or total amount of cellular growth , measured in g.

biomass_amount_molar.description: The total number (or amount) of biomass,  measured in moles.

biomass_lost_in_sample.description: The amount of biomass removed from the bioreactor during sampling, expressed in grams (g).

biomass_formed.description: The total amount of biomass, cumulative biomass producton, formed during the bioprocess, expressed in g.

biomass_formed_molar.description: The total amount of biomass, cumulative biomass producton, formed during the bioprocess, expressed in moles (mol).

biomass_formed_c_molar.description: The total amount of biomass, cumulative biomass producton, formed during the bioprocess, expressed in carbon moles (c-mol).

biomass_formation_rate.description: Rx: The rate at which the biomass is produced over time. expressed in grams per hour (g/h).

biomass_formation_rate_molar.description: Rx: The rate at which the biomass is produced over time. expressed in c-mols per hour (c-mols/h).

biomass_specific_growth_rate_u.description: Î¼: The specific growth rate at which the biomass(X) grows per unit of biomass. Units: 1/h.

biomass_specific_growth_rate_u_mean_in_f.synonyms: Biomass specific growth rate Î¼_mean in Feed
biomass_specific_growth_rate_u_mean_in_f.description: The average specific growth rate of biomass during the feeding phase, expressed in per hour (1/h).

biomass_specific_growth_rate_u_max_in_fe.synonyms: Biomass specific growth rate Î¼_max in Feed
biomass_specific_growth_rate_u_max_in_fe.description: The maximum specific growth rate of biomass during the feeding phase, expressed in per hour (1/h).

biomass_specific_growth_rate_u_min_in_fe.synonyms: Biomass specific growth rate Î¼_min in Feed
biomass_specific_growth_rate_u_min_in_fe.description: The minimum specific growth rate of biomass during the feeding phase, expressed in per hour (1/h).

biomass_yield_s.description: Ysx: grams of biomass produced per grams of substrate consumed, describing the efficiency of substrate conversion into biomass, expressed in g/g.

biomass_yield_molar_s.description: The biomass produced per mole of substrate consumed, expressed in c-mol/mol(S)

biomass_yield_c_molar_s.description: The biomass produced per carbon mole of substrate, considering the carbon efficiency of biomass formation relative to substrate, expressed in c-mol/c-mol(S)
